com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.interaction

Class AutoCompleteBehaviour

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour
      • com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.interaction.AutoCompleteBehaviour

  • public class AutoCompleteBehaviour
extends com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour
    Base class for autocomplete behaviour for text fields - derive your own behaviour classes in order to provide the custom autocomplete list data.
    Author:
    Robert Rohm<r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AutoCompleteBehaviour.CompletionMode
      Mode constants for the autocomplete behaviour: whether to replace the current content of the text field or whether to append the selected text from the list view.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour

        com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour.Mode

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static javafx.scene.control.TextField currentTextfield 
      protected javafx.collections.transformation.FilteredList<java.lang.String> filteredList
      The filtered data list is maintained per behaviour instance.
      static javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> listView
      The list view component for the autocomplete popup.
      static AutoCompleteBehaviour.CompletionMode mode
      Whether to replace the current textfield content with the selected text from the list (default behaviour) or whether to append the selected text to the content of the text field.
      static javafx.stage.Popup popup
      The popup node - it contains the list view component and is maintained only once, thus, also derived classes must reuse this instance.
      protected javafx.scene.control.TextField textfield
      The current textfield that the behaviour methods operate on - it, too, is maintained per instance.

      • Fields inherited from class com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour

        assignmentMode, onDragDetected, onDragDone, onDragDropped, onDragEntered, onDragExited, onDragOver, onKeyPressed, onKeyReleased, onKeyTyped, onMouseClicked, onMouseDragEntered, onMouseDragExited, onMouseDragged, onMouseDragOver, onMouseDragReleased, onMouseEntered, onMouseExited, onMouseMoved, onMousePressed, onMouseReleased

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AutoCompleteBehaviour()
      Create a new behaviour instance - at present, there may be multiple instances of one behaviour class, so it must be taken care of initializing the instanze properties while not modifying static class properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void applySelection()
      Apply the selected item, i.e., according to the completion mode either append it to the current text (retaining the already typed characters) or replace the current text with the selected item.

      Bind the beahviour instance to a node - currently only TextField and descendants are supported, because this behaviour listens on the text property.
      private void createPopup()
      Build the popup control with the list view, and implement the following behaviour: On ESCAPE, hide th popup.
      protected javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getData()
      Override this method to define your custom lookup data list, but keep in mind: the data list instance is used as a base list for the filtered list in the popup, thus it must not change later at runtime.
      protected static int getLastSeparatorPos(java.lang.String t)
      Helper method, get the last position of the recognized separators (blank, comma and dot), or return -1 if not found.
      private static int getMax(int... positions)
      Get the maximum out of several int values, returns 0 if no values given.
      private void handle(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Initial key event handler, filters out unwanted key events, but then delegates to the showPopup(javafx.scene.control.TextField) method.
      private void showPopup(javafx.scene.control.TextField textfield)
      Show the popup, if it is not already showing, and if the filtered list contains at least one item.

    • Field Detail

      • popup

        public static javafx.stage.Popup popup
        The popup node - it contains the list view component and is maintained only once, thus, also derived classes must reuse this instance.

      • listView

        public static final javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> listView
        The list view component for the autocomplete popup. As like the popup, also the listview is maintained only once for the whole framework. All derived autocomplete behaviours should reuse this instance.

      • filteredList

        protected javafx.collections.transformation.FilteredList<java.lang.String> filteredList
        The filtered data list is maintained per behaviour instance.

      • textfield

        protected javafx.scene.control.TextField textfield
        The current textfield that the behaviour methods operate on - it, too, is maintained per instance.

      • currentTextfield

        private static javafx.scene.control.TextField currentTextfield

      • mode

        public static AutoCompleteBehaviour.CompletionMode mode
        Whether to replace the current textfield content with the selected text from the list (default behaviour) or whether to append the selected text to the content of the text field.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AutoCompleteBehaviour

        public AutoCompleteBehaviour()
        Create a new behaviour instance - at present, there may be multiple instances of one behaviour class, so it must be taken care of initializing the instanze properties while not modifying static class properties.

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public void bind(javafx.scene.Node node,
                 com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour.Mode assignmentMode)
        Bind the beahviour instance to a node - currently only TextField and descendants are supported, because this behaviour listens on the text property. Attention! At present, this method asumes that the text property is only manipulated from the FX thread. Normally, this should be the case, anyway. This might fail, if any code fires key events from outside the FX thread.
        Overrides:
        bind in class com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.FXAbstractBehaviour
        Parameters:
        node - The node to bind the behaviour to
        assignmentMode - The assignement mode, i.e., whether to add event listeners or to replace existing event listeners.
        Throws:
        com.aeonium.javafx.behaviour.UnsupportedBehaviourTargetException - If the method is applied to nodes other than javafx.scene.control.TextField or descendants.

      • getLastSeparatorPos

        protected static int getLastSeparatorPos(java.lang.String t)
        Helper method, get the last position of the recognized separators (blank, comma and dot), or return -1 if not found.
        Parameters:
        t - The text string to be examined.
        Returns:
        The last position of recognized separators, or -1 if none of them found.

      • getData

        protected javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getData()
        Override this method to define your custom lookup data list, but keep in mind: the data list instance is used as a base list for the filtered list in the popup, thus it must not change later at runtime. If you need to implement a dynamic data list, better create event handlers that modify the list instance created in this method.
        Returns:
        The lookup data list.

      • createPopup

        private void createPopup()
        Build the popup control with the list view, and implement the following behaviour:
        1. On ESCAPE, hide th popup.
        2. On Enter, apply the selection.
        3. On doubleclick on a selected item, apply the selection.
        4. On doubleclick in empty space, do not change the content and hide the popup.

      • applySelection

        protected void applySelection()
        Apply the selected item, i.e., according to the completion mode either append it to the current text (retaining the already typed characters) or replace the current text with the selected item.

      • showPopup

        private void showPopup(javafx.scene.control.TextField textfield)
        Show the popup, if it is not already showing, and if the filtered list contains at least one item.
        Parameters:
        textfield - The textfield that this method currently operates on. Since the behaviour logic is provided by static methods, this method eventually must take care for initialising static data accordingly to the current textfield.

      • handle

        private void handle(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Initial key event handler, filters out unwanted key events, but then delegates to the showPopup(javafx.scene.control.TextField) method.
        Parameters:
        event - The current key event.

      • getMax

        private static int getMax(int... positions)
        Get the maximum out of several int values, returns 0 if no values given.
        Parameters:
        positions - The int values.
        Returns:
        The maximum or 0 if no values given.
